question: 3 (c)
sols_html:
The function \(\displaystyle f''(x)\) is continuous if the second derivative of adjacent polynomials coincide at x2 and x3. In our case this means

\[\begin{aligned} p''_1(x_2) = p''_2(x_2) \\ p''_2(x_3) = p''_3(x_3)\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
The function <math>\displaystyle f''(x)</math> is continuous if the second derivative of adjacent polynomials coincide at ''x<sub>2</sub>'' and ''x<sub>3</sub>''. In our case this means
:<math>
\begin{align}
p''_1(x_2) = p''_2(x_2) \\ 
p''_2(x_3) = p''_3(x_3)
\end{align}
</math>
statement_html:
Suppose we are given 4 points (x1, y1), (x2, y2), (x3, y3) and (x4, y4) in the plane and we want to find a function \(f\)(x), defined for \(x_1 \leq x \leq x_4\), whose graph interpolates these points. Assume that

\[\begin{aligned} f(x) = \begin{cases} p_1(x) & \text{for } x_1 \leq x \leq x_2 \\ p_2(x) & \text{for } x_2 \leq x \leq x_3 \\ p_3(x) & \text{for } x_3 \leq x \leq x_4 \end{cases}\end{aligned}\]

where each pi(x) is a polynomial.

(c) What equations, written in term of pi(x) and possibly their derivatives, express the condition that \(\displaystyle f''(x)\) is continuous?
statement_latex:
Suppose we are given 4 points (\emph{x}\textsubscript{1},
\emph{y}\textsubscript{1}), (\emph{x}\textsubscript{2},
\emph{y}\textsubscript{2}), (\emph{x}\textsubscript{3},
\emph{y}\textsubscript{3}) and (\emph{x}\textsubscript{4},
\emph{y}\textsubscript{4}) in the plane and we want to find a function
\emph{$f$(x)}, defined for $x_1 \leq x \leq x_4$, whose graph interpolates
these points. Assume that

\begin{align*}
f(x) = \begin{cases}
p_1(x) & \text{for } x_1 \leq x \leq x_2 \\
p_2(x) & \text{for } x_2 \leq x \leq x_3 \\
p_3(x) & \text{for } x_3 \leq x \leq x_4
\end{cases}
\end{align*}

where each \emph{p}\textsubscript{i}(\emph{x}) is a polynomial.

\textbf{(c)} What equations, written in term of
\emph{p}\textsubscript{i}(\emph{x}) and possibly their derivatives,
express the condition that $\displaystyle f''(x)$ is continuous?
